::Shadow Wing::

She flew heading west.  She knew that she could be tracked from her 
signal. She turned her head and looked back to see if she was being 
followed.  She didn't see any bot following her.  She faced west 
again.  She could see a snow and eletrical storm up ahead.  She 
thought the electricity would disrupt her signal so she couldn't be 
tracked.  But she would risk getting hit by lightening.  She took a 
deep breath. "Yeah, better risk it than get scrapped."

She headed straight for the storm.


---Original Message---
--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> The wolf got a beed on her location and started running toward it. 
He 
> just hoped that it was a typical Pred following her. "All guns no 
> brains" he said to himself. The Pred broadcast information on all 
> channels, maybe he didn't know how to tap into direct 
communication. 
> Lunarpine didn't want to underestimate the Pred, it could be a trap.
